steps.title: The devil horns sign is not related to the devil, though some believe it is.
steps.content: The devil horns sign is not related to the devil, though some believe it is. The devil horns hand sign is primarily used as an apotropaic gesture to ward off evil or to celebrate heavy metal or rock music. However, due to its association with heavy metal and some satanic religions, some people see the gesture as a sign of the devil. The original Italian name for this gesture, le corna , most likely refers to bull horns, which are commonly associated with strength and protection. [9] X Research source

steps.title: The rock sign comes from the ancient devil horns hand sign.
